Recipe.title: Monkey Bread
Recipe.Source: Not sure where we got this.
Recipe.Description: This dish is fairly easy to make and is a lot of fun to eat. Basically, kids end up acting like monkeys taking small handfuls and eating it.

section.instruction: In a large bag (such as a 1-gallon Ziploc) combine Sugar and Cinnamon.
Remove each Biscuit from the tube and cut them into 4 pieces each.
Place about 10 Biscuit pieces into the bag of Cinnamon Sugar and shake until they are completely covered.
Place coated pieces into a Tube Pan (such as a Bundt Pan).
Repeat steps 3-4 until all pieces are placed into the pan.
In a separate pan, melt the Butter, and stir in the Brown Sugar.
Pour the Butter mixture over the pieces in the Tube Pan.
Put the Monkey Bread onto a plate as follows:

Notes.note: When it first comes out of the oven, the sugar has caramelized and is very hot. It will cause burns if you touch it at this point! Make sure to let it cool.

Modifications.modification: If you don't have a Tube Pan, reduce Biscuit Dough to only 2 Tubes, and use a bread loaf pan.
Do not use a cake pan, or anything similar as it will leave the center doughy and the edges overdone.
